fusionlibrary.fusion_models.mcvae_tabÔÉÅ

This module implements the MCVAE (multi-channel variational autoencoder) model for fusing two types of tabular data.

Functions

class fusionlibrary.fusion_models.mcvae_tab.MCVAE_tab(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

This class implements a model that fuses the two types of tabular data using the MCVAE approach. MCVAE: multi-channel variational autoencoder.

The MCVAE creates a joint latent space of the two types of tabular data based off a joint latent prior and joint decoding.

method_nameÔÉÅ

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_typeÔÉÅ

Type of modality.

Type:

str

fusion_typeÔÉÅ

Type of fusion.

Type:

str

subspace_methodÔÉÅ

Class of the subspace method.

Type:

class

mod1_layersÔÉÅ

Dictionary containing the layers of the 1st type of tabular data. Here the first type of tabular data is the joint latent space created

in the mcvae_subspace_method class.

Type:

dict

fused_layersÔÉÅ

Sequential layer containing the fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

final_predictionÔÉÅ

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

forward(x)[source]ÔÉÅ

Forward pass of the model.

References

Antelmi, L., Ayache, N., Robert, P., & Lorenzi, M. (2019). Sparse Multi-Channel Variational

Autoencoder for the Joint Analysis of Heterogeneous Data. Proceedings of the 36th International Conference on Machine Learning, 302‚Äì311. https://proceedings.mlr.press/v97/antelmi19a.html

  • verbose (bool) ‚Äì Whether to print out information

Converts the test dataset to the latent space.

get_latents(dataset)[source]ÔÉÅ

Gets the latent representations of the multimodal dataset. The two latent spaces are averaged to form the joint latent space.

Parameters:

dataset (list) ‚Äì List containing the two types of tabular data.

Returns:

mean_latents ‚Äì Array containing the mean latents of the dataset.

Return type:
